intro: Myrsine myrtoides, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are small, red berries that are edible for some bird species, aiding in seed dispersal. Myrsine myrtoides is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
